segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 51
segments.en: Linked Discourses 51

segments.pli: 3. Ayoguḷavagga
segments.en: 3. The Iron Ball

segments.pli: 22. Ayoguḷasutta
segments.en: 22. The Iron Ball

segments.pli: Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “abhijānāti nu kho, bhante, bhagavā iddhiyā manomayena kāyena brahmalokaṃ upasaṅkamitā”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, do you have personal experience of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with a mind-made body?”

segments.pli: “Abhijānāmi khvāhaṃ, ānanda, iddhiyā manomayena kāyena brahmalokaṃ upasaṅkamitā”ti.
segments.en: “I do, Ānanda.”

segments.pli: “Abhijānāti pana, bhante, bhagavā iminā cātumahābhūtikena kāyena iddhiyā brahmalokaṃ upasaṅkamitā”ti?
segments.en: “But do you have personal experience of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with this body made up of the four primary elements?”

segments.pli: “Abhijānāmi khvāhaṃ, ānanda, iminā cātumahābhūtikena kāyena iddhiyā brahmalokaṃ upasaṅkamitā”ti.
segments.en: “I do, Ānanda.”

segments.pli: “Yañca kho omāti, bhante, bhagavā iddhiyā manomayena kāyena brahmalokaṃ upasaṅkamituṃ, yañca kho abhijānāti, bhante, bhagavā iminā cātumahābhūtikena kāyena iddhiyā brahmalokaṃ upasaṅkamitā, tayidaṃ, bhante, bhagavato acchariyañceva abbhutañcā”ti.
segments.en: “It’s incredible and amazing that the Buddha is capable of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with a mind-made body! And that he has personal experience of going to the Brahmā realm by psychic power with this body made up of the four primary elements!”

segments.pli: “Acchariyā ceva, ānanda, tathāgatā acchariyadhammasamannāgatā ca, abbhutā ceva, ānanda, tathāgatā abbhutadhammasamannāgatā ca.
segments.en: “Ānanda, the Realized Ones are incredible and have incredible qualities. They’re amazing and have amazing qualities.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, ānanda, samaye tathāgato kāyampi citte samodahati cittampi kāye samodahati, sukhasaññañca lahusaññañca kāye okkamitvā viharati;
segments.en: Sometimes the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.

segments.pli: tasmiṃ, ānanda, samaye tathāgatassa kāyo lahutaro ceva hoti mudutaro ca kammaniyataro ca pabhassarataro ca.
segments.en: At that time his body becomes lighter, softer, more workable, and more radiant.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, ayoguḷo divasaṃ santatto lahutaro ceva hoti mudutaro ca kammaniyataro ca pabhassarataro ca;
segments.en: Suppose there was an iron ball that had been heated all day. It’d become lighter, softer, more workable, and more radiant.

segments.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ samaye tathāgato kāyampi citte samodahati, cittampi kāye samodahati, sukhasaññañca lahusaññañca kāye okkamitvā viharati;
segments.en: In the same way, sometimes the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.

segments.pli: tasmiṃ, ānanda, samaye tathāgatassa kāyo lahutaro ceva hoti mudutaro ca kammaniyataro ca pabhassarataro ca.
segments.en: At that time his body becomes lighter, softer, more workable, and more radiant.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, ānanda, samaye tathāgato kāyampi citte samodahati, cittampi kāye samodahati, sukhasaññañca lahusaññañca kāye okkamitvā viharati;
segments.en: Sometimes the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.

segments.pli: tasmiṃ, ānanda, samaye tathāgatassa kāyo appakasireneva pathaviyā vehāsaṃ abbhuggacchati,
segments.en: At that time his body easily rises up from the ground into the air.

segments.pli: so anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti … pe … yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteti.
segments.en: He wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying himself and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, tūlapicu vā kappāsapicu vā lahuko vātūpādāno appakasireneva pathaviyā vehāsaṃ abbhuggacchati;
segments.en: Suppose there was a light tuft of cotton-wool or kapok. Taken up by the wind, it would easily rise up from the ground into the air.

segments.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ samaye tathāgato kāyampi citte samodahati, cittampi kāye samodahati, sukhasaññañca lahusaññañca kāye okkamitvā viharati;
segments.en: In the same way, sometimes the Realized One submerges his body in his mind and his mind in his body. He meditates after sinking into a perception of bliss and lightness in the body.

segments.pli: tasmiṃ, ānanda, samaye tathāgatassa kāyo appakasireneva pathaviyā vehāsaṃ abbhuggacchati,
segments.en: At that time his body easily rises up from the ground into the air.

segments.pli: so anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti … pe … yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattetī”ti.
segments.en: He wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying himself and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Ānanda asks the Buddha whether he travels to the Brahmā realm in a mind-made body or in a physical body.
